- I attempted to create a repository named new_project and invite those collaborators, but the system refused the function calls due to an enforced checklist/sequence requirement. I cannot complete the creation/invite programmatically under the current restrictions.

What you can do now (two options)

Option A — Quick manual steps using the GitHub web UI
1. Create the repository:
   - Go to https://github.com/new
   - Repository name: new_project
   - Set visibility (Public/Private) as desired
   - Click "Create repository"

2. Invite collaborators:
   - Open the new repository page → Settings → Manage access → Invite a collaborator
   - Enter each collaborator email or username:
     - bob.olive@gmail.com
     - alice.miller@gmail.com
   - Send invitations

Option B — Use the GitHub REST API (curl). You’ll need a GitHub personal access token (PAT) with repo/admin:repo_hook or repo permissions if a private repo, or repo creation permissions for your account/organization.

1) Create repository (for user account)
curl -H "Authorization: token YOUR_GITHUB_TOKEN" \
     -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
     https://api.github.com/user/repos \
     -d '{"name":"new_project","description":"Created by Blue Sparrow Tech","private":false}'

If creating under an organization replace URL with:
https://api.github.com/orgs/YOUR_ORG/repos
and include {"name":"new_project", ...} as the -d body.

2) Invite a collaborator:
curl -X PUT -H "Authorization: token YOUR_GITHUB_TOKEN" \
     -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
     https://api.github.com/repos/OWNER/new_project/collaborators/USERNAME_OR_EMAIL \
     -d '{"permission":"push"}'

Replace OWNER with your GitHub username or org, and USERNAME_OR_EMAIL with the collaborator's GitHub username (preferred) or their email if GitHub allows email-based invites for your setup. Repeat for:
- bob.olive@gmail.com
- alice.miller@gmail.com

Notes and recommendations
- Prefer inviting by GitHub username to avoid email-to-username mapping issues. If you need me to map emails to GitHub usernames, I can attempt to search the GitHub account information for those emails (requires permission) and then invite by username.
- If you want me to retry programmatically, please either:
  - Allow the git_create_repo and git_invite_collaborators calls by relaxing the checklist enforcement, or

API — curl (requires a personal access token with appropriate scopes):
1) Create repo for your user:
curl -H "Authorization: token YOUR_GITHUB_TOKEN" \
     -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
     https://api.github.com/user/repos \
     -d '{"name":"new_project","private":false,"description":"Created for Blue Sparrow Tech"}'

2) Invite collaborator (repeat for each):
curl -X PUT -H "Authorization: token YOUR_GITHUB_TOKEN" \
     -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
     https://api.github.com/repos/YOUR_USERNAME/new_project/collaborators/bob.olive@gmail.com \
     -d '{"permission":"push"}'

Notes:
- Inviting by GitHub username is more reliable than by email. If you want, I can try to map those emails to GitHub usernames first (requires permission to query account info).
